intro: Seseli libanotis f. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth Lebanon sesame, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It is native to the eastern Mediterranean, including parts of Lebanon and Syria. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
